Intervention: The chemotherapy course consists of 500 mg/m2 cyclophosphate, 50 mg/m2 doxorubicin and 500 mg/m2 fluorouracil administered intravenously in one day.

Panagen 5 mg tablets orally every 2-3 h (six times a day) for 18 days. Patients start receiving the preparation immediately after chemotherapy and take three tablets for 6 h, i.e. one tablet every 2 h. Then, patients stop taking the preparation and resume administration after 42 h, i.e. 48 h after chemotherapy (Day 3) and continue administration for 17 days (Day 20 after chemotherapy).
The chemotherapy course consists of 500 mg/m2 cyclophosphate, 50 mg/m2 doxorubicin and 500 mg/m2 fluorouracil administered intravenously in one day.

Patients start receiving placebo tablets immediately after chemotherapy and take three tablets for 6 h, i.e. one tablet every 2 h. Then patients stop taking the preparation and resume administration after 42 h, i.e. 48 h after chemotherapy (day 3) and continue administration for 17 days (day 20 after chemotherapy).
Eligibility: Incorporation criteria:
Signed and dated informed written consent
Women 18 years of age
Stage II-IV breast cancer (with distant metastases)
Patients will undergo chemotherapy with cyclophosphane/doxorubicin/fluorouracil as standard chemotherapy for the treatment of breast cancer.
Patients have not previously undergone chemotherapy.
• Functional status according to the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) 2
Number of leukocytes of 3 × 109/L prior to treatment
Number of neutrophils of 1.5 × 109/L prior to treatment
Number of platelets 100 × 109/L prior to treatment
Adequate cardiac function

adequate hepatic function, i.e. alanine aminotransferase/aspartate aminotransferase (ALT/ASAT) activity < 2.5 × upper limit of normal (ULN); acid phosphatase activity < 5 × ULN; and bilirubin concentration < 5 × ULN; and
adequate renal function, i.e. creatinine concentration in blood serum < 1.5 × ULN; urea concentration < ULN; and endogenous clearance of creatinine
- Exclusion criteria:
• Participation in clinical trials less than 30 days prior to sequential randomization
A prior exposure to Panagen or any other leucostimulatory medicinal product at a stage of clinical development
Hypersensitivity to cyclophosphane, doxorubicin or fluoruracil
● Therapy with systemic active antibiotics less than 72 h prior to the start of chemotherapy
• Long-term oral use of corticosteroids
Prior radiation therapy was performed less than 4 weeks prior to randomization.
A Previous Transplantation of Hematopoietic Stem Cells
Other malignant neoplasms in the last 5 years, except basal or flat cell carcinomas or intraepithelial cervix carcinomas
Any disease or condition that, in the opinion of the researcher, may affect the patient's safety or the estimation of a final test point; and
Pregnant and lactating women; fertile patients should use chemical contraceptives or barrier contraceptives during the trial period
Results: The amount of leukocytes and neutrophils in patients' blood
Delay: Baseline, 21st day after 2nd chemotherapy (day 42 after basic chemotherapy), 21st day after 3rd chemotherapy (day 63 after basic chemotherapy)
Title of the arm/group: Chemotherapy & Panagen
Description of the arm/group: Chemotherapy: The chemotherapy course consists of 500 mg/m2 cyclophosphate, 50 mg/m2 doxorubicin and 500 mg/m2 fluorouracil administered intravenously in one day.

Panagen 5 mg tablets orally every 2-3 h (six times a day) for 18 days. Patients start receiving the preparation immediately after chemotherapy and take three tablets for 6 h, i.e. one tablet every 2 h. Then, patients stop taking the preparation and resume administration after 42 h, i.e. 48 h after chemotherapy (Day 3) and continue administration for 17 days (Day 20 after chemotherapy).
Unit of measurement: 10^9 leukocyte base cells/L: 8.1 (6.5 to 8.8)
To the inclusion of neutrophils: 5.33 (4.42 to 6.36)
Title of the arm/group: Chemotherapy & Placebo
Description of the arm/group: Chemotherapy: The chemotherapy course consists of 500 mg/m2 cyclophosphate, 50 mg/m2 doxorubicin and 500 mg/m2 fluorouracil administered intravenously in one day.

Patients start receiving placebo tablets immediately after chemotherapy and take three tablets for 6 h, i.e. one tablet every 2 h. Then patients stop taking the preparation and resume administration after 42 h, i.e. 48 h after chemotherapy (day 3) and continue administration for 17 days (day 20 after chemotherapy).
Unit of measurement: 10^9 leukocyte base cells/L: 7.2 (6.5 to 7.9)
To the inclusion of neutrophils: 5.2 (4.2 to 6.55)
